body:
@albertony 
You know Windows better than me.
Do you think that the following will work with ANY external program on Windows? It looks strange to me:
```
sftp cmd = /C:/test\ folder/example1/file1.txt
```

I think that rclone before passing command to the SSH remote invoker, should turn both command and parameter (or just parameter if command is in PATH) into absolute windows paths, like in this pseudo-example:
```
C:\path\to\hash_command.exe X:\path\to\remote\folder\example1\file1.txt
```

**Offtopic**: in future it might be useful to configure passing other cli args into the command via template with macros like the coined example `md5_command = md5sum.exe /opt1 {abs_win_path} /opt2 {slash_rel_path}`, but it's out of scope for this ticket. Just an idea.

> Do you think that the following will work with ANY external program on Windows?

Hard to tell 100%, but it *should* definitely work, because the underlying Windows API does handle both path separators:
> Almost all paths passed to Windows APIs are normalized. Windows performs the following steps: [...] All forward slashes (/) are converted into the standard Windows separator, the back slash (\\). If they are present, a series of slashes that follow the first two slashes are collapsed into a single slash.

(https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/standard/io/file-path-formats#path-normalization)

You have the *almost all* part there, but it works everywhere I can think of. With command line arguments, of course, the individual programs can perform their own operations on the path before its being passed to any api, and these may only handle backslash.

Is the problem here not the space in path? This `test\ folder` will not work, and I don't think you can consistently escape spaces in Windows any other way either. Double quotes is the way to handle them.

>  I don't think you can consistently escape spaces in Windows any other way either. Double quotes is the way to handle them.

Do you assume that the SSHd will pass string(s) to Powershell? I'm afraid that rclone cannot generally assume that. Depending on concrete SSHd they can pass to CMD or just parse directly.

> Is the problem here not the space in path?

Not only that. I see another problem with path being relative. OK, rclone can treat it relative to the remote root.
Will SSHd treat it relative to what? user home, OpenSSH install dir, C:\windows\system32?

> Do you assume that the SSHd will pass string(s) to Powershell? I'm afraid that rclone cannot generally assume that. Depending on concrete SSHd they can pass to CMD or just parse directly.

No, I did not assume that in my comment (if that was what you meant). Escaping spaces is not something I would rely on at all, in Windows. One could do that specifically for PowerShell, but it uses the special backtick escape character and not backslash anyway.  So I would say either no quotes, and *hope* the sshd adds quotes as necessary before passing to shell/API, or wrap in double quotes (when spaces, or perhaps always). But I do not have much experience with ftp, and not the complete picture of this case either, perhaps..

GitHub repo for Windows' port of OpenSSH is https://github.com/PowerShell/openssh-portable for source and https://github.com/PowerShell/Win32-OpenSSH for issue tracking, and mentions quite a few issues about quotes etc. And also I've seen the following comment:
> We need to consolidate these changes into posix_spawn* logic and call posix_spawn* from session.c (instead of CreateProcess).

Don't know the current status on this...

Guessing the code used for executing command on windows is here:

https://github.com/PowerShell/openssh-portable/blob/5cb32671670f599f97075c396ba68af2d9bb27b3/contrib/win32/win32compat/w32-doexec.c#L240

It seems to me one can supply unescaped, unquoted path, and it will be wrapped in quotes if necessary. Though there is a registry option to disable this, and there is pty vs non-pty, and conditions on type of shell etc.. Would need to spend some more time than I have right now at least, for investigating, and probably testing, to know for sure.

> Not only that. I see another problem with path being relative. OK, rclone can treat it relative to the remote root.
Will SSHd treat it relative to what? user home, OpenSSH install dir, C:\windows\system32?

Oh, yes, you mean when specifying `--sftp-sha1sum-command "sha1sum"`, that sha1sum is relative path to executable that sshd should run? I would not rely on any assumptions on what that resolves according to, nor think rclone should do anything about it. Isn't this a responsibility of the user? If the command is in PATH then it could be given as in that example, otherwise should use absolute path?

> Oh, yes, you mean when specifying --sftp-sha1sum-command "sha1sum", that sha1sum is relative path to executable that sshd should run?

No. I don't expect problems with Xsum executable. I think SSHd can find it on the PATH in most cases.

I see problems with **file parameter** passed to Xsum executable. In the debug line it looks like it's relative. But relative to what in the Xsum world?

> In the debug line it looks like it's relative

Where?

> > In the debug line it looks like it's relative
> 
> Where?

Sorry I misinterpreted this as "relative":

`cmd = /C:/test\ folder/example1/file1.txt`

Frankly, I don't know Windows. I thought their absolute paths should look like `C:\xxx`. Forget it. Sorry.
I was thinking it could be that, easy mistake, no problem!

So I guess the remaining problem is this, which does not do the correct thing when sshd is on Windows (not necessarily, at least, probably depending on configured shell) 

https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/00ceeef21ce55bc8daee4a3c437a00fb4fc4fff5/backend/sftp/sftp.go#L1296-L1303

Escaping should probably depend on remote shell on SSHd side:
- windows/powershell
- windows/cmd
- unix (any shell: sh, bash, ksh, csh, zsh, etc)
- something else ??

I don't see an easy way to auto-detect it,
so it needs a new flag like
`--sftp-remote-shell=unix(default)|powershell|cmd`

Just idea

> * something else ??

Cygwin - best/worst(?) of both worlds ðŸ˜¨ 

> I don't see an easy way to auto-detect it,

If that is true (I don't know), then:

> so it needs a new flag like
> `--sftp-remote-shell=unix(default)|powershell|cmd`

I agree.

@SteveBox0 
Please help us investigate
Will the problem persist if you:
1. Copy sha1sum.exe somewhere on default path, e.g. `C:\Windows\system32\sha1sum.exe` ?
2. Rename your test folder to avoid whitespace?
```
rclone sha1sum windows:/C:/test_folder/example1/ --sftp-sha1sum-command sha1sum -vv
```

#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`

https://forum.rclone.org/t/windows-sha1sum-via-sftp/27160

- Direct Folder Test
```
rclone sha1sum "windows:/C:/test_folder/example1/" --sftp-sha1sum-command "sha1sum" -vv --sftp-path-override "C:\test_folder\example1"
2021/10/26 23:06:32 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.57.0-beta.5801.bb11803f1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sha1sum" "windows:/C:/test_folder/example1/" "--sftp-sha1sum-command" "sha1sum" "-vv" "--sftp-path-override" "C:\\test_folder\\example1"]
2021/10/26 23:06:32 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "windows:/C:/test_folder/example1/"
2021/10/26 23:06:32 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/user/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2021/10/26 23:06:32 DEBUG : windows: detected overridden config - adding "{zmpfa}" suffix to name
2021/10/26 23:06:32 DEBUG : sftp://****@****:22//C:/test_folder/example1/: New connection ****:57362->****:22 to "SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_for_Windows_8.1"
2021/10/26 23:06:32 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "windows:/C:/test_folder/example1/" to be canonical "windows{zmpfa}:/C:/test_folder/example1/"
2021/10/26 23:06:33 DEBUG : sftp cmd = C:\\test_folder\\example1/file1.txt
2021/10/26 23:06:33 DEBUG : sftp output = "dad6647784b11394806ca5f5ccea1d246b8b7a26  C:\\\\test_folder\\\\example1/file1.txt\r\n"
2021/10/26 23:06:33 DEBUG : sftp hash = "dad6647784b11394806ca5f5ccea1d246b8b7a26"
dad6647784b11394806ca5f5ccea1d246b8b7a26  file1.txt
2021/10/26 23:06:33 DEBUG : 11 go routines active
user@user-virtual-machine:~$ 
```
- Sub Folder test
```
rclone sha1sum "windows:/C:/test_folder/" --sftp-sha1sum-command "sha1sum" -vv --sftp-path-override "C:\test_folder"
2021/10/26 23:07:57 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.57.0-beta.5801.bb11803f1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sha1sum" "windows:/C:/test_folder/" "--sftp-sha1sum-command" "sha1sum" "-vv" "--sftp-path-override" "C:\\test_folder"]
2021/10/26 23:07:57 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "windows:/C:/test_folder/"
2021/10/26 23:07:57 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/user/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2021/10/26 23:07:57 DEBUG : windows: detected overridden config - adding "{NNAPN}" suffix to name
2021/10/26 23:07:58 DEBUG : sftp://****@****:22//C:/test_folder/: New connection ****:57368->****:22 to "SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_for_Windows_8.1"
2021/10/26 23:07:58 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "windows:/C:/test_folder/" to be canonical "windows{NNAPN}:/C:/test_folder/"
2021/10/26 23:07:58 DEBUG : sftp cmd = C:\\test_folder/example1/file1.txt
2021/10/26 23:07:58 DEBUG : sftp output = "dad6647784b11394806ca5f5ccea1d246b8b7a26  C:\\\\test_folder/example1/file1.txt\r\n"
2021/10/26 23:07:58 DEBUG : sftp hash = "dad6647784b11394806ca5f5ccea1d246b8b7a26"
dad6647784b11394806ca5f5ccea1d246b8b7a26  example1/file1.txt
2021/10/26 23:07:58 DEBUG : 11 go routines active
```

- Space in Folder
```
rclone sha1sum "windows:/C:/test folder/" --sftp-sha1sum-command "sha1sum" -vv --sftp-path-override "C:\test folder"
2021/10/26 23:09:27 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.57.0-beta.5801.bb11803f1" starting with parameters ["rclone" "sha1sum" "windows:/C:/test folder/" "--sftp-sha1sum-command" "sha1sum" "-vv" "--sftp-path-override" "C:\\test folder"]
2021/10/26 23:09:27 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "windows:/C:/test folder/"
2021/10/26 23:09:27 DEBUG : Using config file from "/home/user/.config/rclone/rclone.conf"
2021/10/26 23:09:27 DEBUG : windows: detected overridden config - adding "{r5Yfc}" suffix to name
2021/10/26 23:09:27 DEBUG : sftp://****@****:22//C:/test folder/: New connection ****:57370->****:22 to "SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_for_Windows_8.1"
2021/10/26 23:09:27 DEBUG : fs cache: renaming cache item "windows:/C:/test folder/" to be canonical "windows{r5Yfc}:/C:/test folder/"
2021/10/26 23:09:27 DEBUG : sftp cmd = C:\\test\ folder/example1/file1.txt
2021/10/26 23:09:27 DEBUG : example1/file1.txt: Failed to calculate sha1 hash: Process exited with status 1 (can't open `C:\\test\': No such file or directory)
                                          example1/file1.txt
2021/10/26 23:09:27 DEBUG : 11 go routines active
```

Did a test with latest version of OpenSSH for Windows: Version 8.6, from https://github.com/PowerShell/Win32-OpenSSH/releases (the one available from built-in "Optional Features" is based on the same repo, but last time I checked used a rather old version):
- Fails with space in path, same as OP.
- Works by modifying rclone code in sftp.go:
    - Don't escape space character in `shellEscape`.
    - Surround hash command argument with double quotes (did not work without double quoting):
    ```
    err = session.Run(hashCmd + " \"" + escapedPath + "\"")
    ```
    - Note: This was, obviously, just a quick hack to verify, we still needs proper implementation with flag option as mentioned, and figuring out exactly what and how to escape depending on shell.

OpenSSH_for_Windows_8.1p1, LibreSSL 3.0.2 is the version currently included by Microsoft for both Server 2019 and Server 2022. Tested is couple of versions but the same issue. I dont think its related to the version but as you mentioned the shellEscape method.
Please let me know if you any extra information for the bug fix.

> Please let me know if you any extra information for the bug fix.

Great.

Unless @ivandeex are planning to work on this, I can start on it. I'm a bit worried about time consuming testing of different combinations, so we'll see how it goes...

It would at least be great if you, @SteveBox0, could test out a beta build - when that time comes. And then it would also be great if you could test with different shells configured (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows-server/administration/openssh/openssh_server_configuration#configuring-the-default-shell-for-openssh-in-windows)
